dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOONEE (6) and SCOOTY (7) are outside The Magic Castle Mo purple and run-down. The kids sit against the wall in the shade of an alcove under the stairs outside the main offi The two take turns playing a game on a phone. They hear a small boy, DICKY (7), calling from the distan

dialogues.speaker: DICKY
dialogues.text: Moonee! Scooty!!

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: What!?

dialogues.speaker: DICKY
dialogues.text: Mooneeeeeeeeee! Dicky makes his way to the enclave moving fast.

dialogues.speaker: WHAT
dialogues.text: Steadicam: Begin close on Dicky's screaming face and CONTINUOUS move from the side road parallel to Route 192 behind Dicky, following him running towards the motel.

dialogues.speaker: WHAT
dialogues.text: Dicky arrives at the enclave.

dialogues.speaker: DICKY
dialogues.text: Freshies at The Future! Moonee and Scooty are enthralled.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE / SCOOTY
dialogues.text: Freshies at The Future!!! They jump up and exit frame. We hold on the purple wall. “Celebration” by Kool & the Gang blasts over the OPENING TITLES that play out as we continue to hold on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonee, Scooty and Dicky make their way to the end of the motel’s driveway. PAN RIGHT to follow them and reveal Rou 192 in full.  The kids run to the adjacent property -- FUTURELAND INN (located a block West from The Magic Castle).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonee/Scooty/Dicky arrive at the entrance to FutureLand. Scuffed-up retro-futuristic rockets adorn the weather-dam sign in front, its logo embedded within a constellation. faded ‘Stay in the future... today!’ sign dangles below i Moonee/Scooty/Dicky run off the sidewalk and onto the law the shanty motel. They peer around a dirty wall. Their eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: DICKY
dialogues.text: That one. The blue one. The kids run upstairs to the second floor and look toward ground halfway down the walkway. They begin spitting downward.

dialogues.speaker: DICKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can get it farther than you, Moonee.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: No way. I’1l1 totally get it much farther than you!

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTY
dialogues.text: Yeah but I bet none of you can get it on the top! EXT. FUTURELAND INN - JANCEY’S ROOM - DAY GRANDMA STACY (younger than your average Grandma) steps o onto the walkway. She lights a cigarette, taking in her n environment. She looks to her left where a YOUNG MAN and PITBULL are lounging down the walkway. She nods to him. She continues to smoke. Something grabs her attention. Sh approaches her blue 90's Toyota Corolla to see a spit-cov windshield. A gob of spit shoots down onto it from above. looks to the upper floor.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA STACY
dialogues.text: What the fuck? HEY! Moonee/Scooty/Dicky slide back and laugh.  GRANDMA STACY (CONT’D) Are you kidding me over here? You get down here and clean this shit up now! The commotion causes Jancey and her young sister LUCI (4) emerge from the room. The kids continue to LAUGH HYSTERICALLY. Moonee jumps up and spits blindly through the rail.

dialogues.speaker: DICKY
dialogues.text: Go home, you rachet bitch!

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTY
dialogues.text: You ain’t shit, jit!

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: You are shit! Jancey gets hit by a gob of spit.

dialogues.speaker: JANCEY
dialogues.text: Gramma, he spit on me.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: (offended) It wasn’t him, it was ME, stupid

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA STACY
dialogues.text: Hey! I’m coming up there and I am fucking telling your parents! Moonee/Scooty/Dicky get up and race down the walkway of t second floor, the screaming back and forth persists.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Try it, bee-otch. I don’t even live here! Moonee/Scooty/Dicky LAUGH hysterically while running away Stacy fumes. Jancey and her little sister Luci stand by t door, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonee, Scooty and Dicky race to the other side of Future and down the stairs. They run onto the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA STACY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Get the fuck back here!  4. DICKY’S DAD (40's) is sitting on a ratty lawn chair on th second floor, he spots them racing away. DICKY’S DAD Hey! Dicky... not another step. Get your ass over here. Now. Dicky stops as Moonee and Scooty keep running. Grandma St yells up to Dicky’s Dad.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA STACY
dialogues.text: Are they your kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonee and Scooty return to their home motel and run up t stairs to the third floor. WIDE on the two little kids as they walk down the entire length of the motel toward the elevator/stairwell in the (this is the first big reveal of the geography of The Mag Castle grounds). They reach Moonee’s home -- Room 323.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonee slides the window open from the outside, sticks he right arm in through the curtain and opens the door. HALLEY (22) is in pajamas and lying on the bed, smoking a watching “The Price is Right” on an old 19-inch tube television. Moonee and Scooty enter the room through the window, jump the bed and hop over Halley.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Hey, take your shoes off. Their shoes come off as they grab all the pillows in sigh make a fort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandma Stacy, Jancey and Luci burst into the lobby. A ti looking AMBER (40's, day clerk) looks up.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA STACY
dialogues.text: I want to speak with the manager right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you with something?

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA STACY
dialogues.text: Are you the manager?

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: No, but I’m in charge of...

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA STACY
dialogues.text: I want to speak with the manager now.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: Can I ask what this is regarding?

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA STACY
dialogues.text: Two little shits that live on this property!

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: (turns toward offscreen) Bobby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARD KNOCKS on the door of room 323.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Yeah, what? Moonee runs over to the door and opens it to reveal BOBBY (50's), the motel manager -- focused, overwhelmed and cynical. He wears a wedding ring. He stands with Grandma Stacy/Jancey/Luci. Shy little Janc stands behind her livid grandmother and peers inside. Moo immediately SLAMS THE DOOR in his face and walks back to bed.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Moonee? Who’s that?

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Nobody.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Shit, Moonee. What did you two do?

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTY
dialogues.text: Nothin’.  6. Halley gets up off the bed. She drops her cigarette in he Mountain Dew can. Bobby begins speaking before the door swings all the way back open.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: This woman's from next door. Says Moonee did something to her car.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: You in 322?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: No, FutureLand.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA STACY
dialogues.text: Her and her friend Scoot spit all over my car and my kid here.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTY
dialogues.text: (from under the bed) It’s Scooty, not Scoot! Halley almost laughs.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: You saw them do this?

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA STACY
dialogues.text: I did. Their friend’s father told me that your kids are always pulling this shit.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: He ain’t my kid.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA STACY
dialogues.text: Well, those two, whoever those are.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: ointing at Moonee P g She’s mine.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA STACY
dialogues.text: I don’t give a shit. They spit on my car and over my Jancey here.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Okay, Halley, one, sort this out. Two, you smoke in the room again and you're outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’m not smoking.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Last warning, Halley.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I’m not. Grandma Stacy watches Bobby walk off.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: C’mon, get some paper towels, you two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonee/Scooty approach BERTHA (40's) who is folding laund

dialogues.speaker: BERTHA
dialogues.text: Hola, Scooty y Moonee.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTY
dialogues.text: Toalla de papel.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Por Favor! Bertha grabs a roll of paper towels and hands it to Moone

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire party (Halley/Moonee, Scooty, Grandma Stacy/Jancey/Luci) make their way over to FutureLand Inn.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: These all yours?

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA STACY
dialogues.text: These aren't mine. Well, they’re mine now. My daughter made me a grandmother when she was 15. So I’m looking after them until she stops acting like her stupid father. Halley offers Grandma Stacy a smoke. She accepts. Jancey quiet and stays close to her mother. GRANDMA STACY (CONT’D) (pointing to Jancey) She was on methadone for the first four weeks of her life. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRANDMA STACY (CONT’D) (pointing to Luci) Thank God, she had these two when she was locked up.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: When’d ya move in, Gramma?

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA STACY
dialogues.text: Today.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Whatta they charging you a week?

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: You can get that shit down to $240. Maybe even less knowing that shithead who works the front desk over there.

dialogues.speaker: FUTURELAND INN
dialogues.text: Grandma Stacy smokes a cigarette as she and Halley watch Moonee and Scooty wash the spit-covered car.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Got another one of those? Grandma Stacy rolls her eyes as she gives Halley a cigare As Moonee/Scooty clean the spit off the car, they both ma small talk with Jancey who watches curiously from the sha near her motel room.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: What’s your name?

dialogues.speaker: JANCEY
dialogues.text: Jancey.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTY
dialogues.text: What kind of a name is Jancey?!

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Hey, Jancey? I’m Moonee. And hey...

dialogues.speaker: JANCEY
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sure would be a whole lot easier if we had someone else to help us. Scooty catches onto Moonee’s plan.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTY
dialogues.text: It sure would.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: What would happen if someone was nice enough to volunteer?

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTY
dialogues.text: They would get an award and it would say ‘the bestest ever!’ Jancey grabs a paper towel and goes over to help them.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA STACY
dialogues.text: HEY! Jancey, honey, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: JANCEY
dialogues.text: I’m cleanin’ up!

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA STACY
dialogues.text: No, sweetheart, that’s not your job. It’s those two that have to clean up! Moonee winks at Jancey. Jancey smiles.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Aren’t you glad this happened because now it’s cleaner than it was before!

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Oh let her fuckin’ help.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA STACY
dialogues.text: They're having too much fun. This is not supposed to be fun this is supposed to be work. This is not okay. Not okay at all.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Let them have a good time, it’s kids being kids.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA STACY
dialogues.text: I think it was very disrespectful. Not okay.  10.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Hey! We should clean that inside too, it’s a giant MESS! Scooty cheers.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: You think they’re gonna get along if they don’t socialize?

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA STACY
dialogues.text: Oh just like you?

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Yeah like me, what are you trying to say? Look, you check them for lice yet?

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA STACY
dialogues.text: Lice?

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Half the kids here have lice. I can help you but you wanna be mean to me. So fine. I know this shit. The kids continue to playfully clean the old car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halley and ten other RESIDENTS of The Magic Castle are socializing, drinking and smoking on the balcony. Halley is hanging with her best friend and Scooty's mom, ASHLEY (23) on the stairs outside Room 341 where music is blasting. Some of the rooms’ doors are open and some clos GLORIA (60’s) struts over.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: Hey! Listen up, motherfuckers. You have one of two choices. You can all keep it down OR... you can get a lady a beer. Gloria sits down and joins the crowd and pops open a beer which spills all over her.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: I’m off tomorrow. Want me to take Moonee?  11.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: No, it’s cool, we got our appointment tomorrow. Now, what would happen if we smoke the fattest of blunts right now? We hear Bobby off-screen.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, let’s wrap it up. We have over twenty guests this weekend and we’re already having noise complaints. A few residents can be heard protesting off-screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HALLEY is seated with a CASE WORKER (female, 30’s). Moone messing around with another LITTLE KID (4) while the adul talk.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Most of those rachet-ass bitches were doing extras... ya know, in the back room. (gives a handjob gesture) I'm not doin’ extras. I'm fuckin’ dancing for tips. That’s what I do. I said no... two days later with no warning Hector fires me... after not letting me up on stage all fucking night. Fuckin’ bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: CASE WORKER
dialogues.text: Okay, well... this will affect your TANF.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: No shit. That's why I’m here.

dialogues.speaker: CASE WORKER
dialogues.text: Okay, you need to make a concerted effort to find at least thirty hours.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: (frustrated) Yeah, well you find me thirty hours! I have applications in at every shithole up and down Irlo Bronson and the parks ain’t going to hire me.  12.

dialogues.speaker: CASE WORKER
dialogues.text: You can cover those up, Halley. Halley is thrown off for a second. She then realizes the worker is referring to her tattoos.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: No, my record. And now that it’s summer and I got her during the day... C’mon.

dialogues.speaker: CASE WORKER
dialogues.text: I get it. But you’ve got to give benefits three job contacts a week or you'll be considered non- compliant. (reading file) And no child support. Halley just shakes her head. CASE WORKER (CONT’D) When is he getting out? Halley shakes her head again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonee and Scooty sit in front of a “Welcome to Florida” mural. They are nodding off. An off-screen WHISTLE wakes up. Scooty’s mom Ashley stands in the front entrance of the f food waffle joint next door. She motions for them to go i back. As they run to the back, reveal that the two kids were sitting on the side of the huge ORANGE WORLD dome right n door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooty and Moonee wait out back. Ashley comes out with a doggy bag.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Thanks, Miss Ashley. My mom wants to know if you want to go to O.B.T. tonight.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: It’s Saturday night, isn’t it?  13.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: (to Scooty) What was yesterday?

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTY
dialogues.text: Yesterday? That was... Friday.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: (to Ashley) Yes, today is Saturday.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: Okay, then we’re gonna go.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Okay, I’1l tell her. Bye, Miss Ashley!

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTY
dialogues.text: Bye, Mommy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonee/Scooty/Halley eat the Waffle Home food picnic-styl a dilapidated playground next to the parking lot of the motel. A HELICOPTER loaded with TOURISTS lifts off next door. Th kids give it the finger as it lifts off for a tour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halley and Ashley are dressed up and ready to party. They deliver Moonee and Scooty to a NEIGHBOR’s room.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Thanks again. Let me know if they misbehave. (to Moonee) Behave, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halley and Ashley are in party mode. Latin food trucks, tricked-out cars, smoke, blasting music. The two girls ma their way around, socialize, eat food and watch as the ca drag race up and down the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: This is the best burrito I’ve ever eaten.  14. We follow the girls docu-style as they socialize. They ge alone time as they eat their food.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They chose Simone.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Are you fuckin’ kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: I know. I been there way longer than that bitch.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: I can’t even believe it. Fuck that.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: The second I’m a manager you’re totally hired, I mean it. Halley’s night is ruined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonee and Scooty approach Dicky’s room on the first floo FutureLand. Dicky’s Dad is lounging outside as usual.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Can Dicky come out and-- DICKY’S DAD Dicky’s being punished. He can’t come out. A MEAN CHIHUAHUA is staring at the kids. They walk away. Moonee stops and turns back.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonee and Scooty knock on Jancey’s door. answers.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA STACY
dialogues.text: Yeah what?

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Can Jancey come out and play? Grandma Stacy  15.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA STACY
dialogues.text: What? You gonna take her to spit on someone else’s car?

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: No, we're just playing.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA STACY
dialogues.text: What are you playing?

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: I dunno. Just playing.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA STACY
dialogues.text: Jance, those kids from the purple place wanna know if you wanna play?

dialogues.speaker: JANCEY
dialogues.text: I wanna play.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA STACY
dialogues.text: No further than Magic Castle, okay? Moonee, Scooty and Jancey run away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonee/Scooty/Jancey walk past the front of Magic Castle headed West.

dialogues.speaker: JANCEY
dialogues.text: Don’t you live there?

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Yeah but we have things to show you.

dialogues.speaker: JANCEY
dialogues.text: My grandma said no further than here.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Well we need ice cream. And this is a tour. Follow us. It’s okay. Jancey hesitates, then makes a decision to take her first step into uncharted territory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonee, Scooty and Jancey walk by a gift shop on Route 19 that has a large Wizard sculpture over it.  16.

dialogues.speaker: JANCEY
dialogues.text: You think we’re going too far?

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Just come on! Jancey stops and looks up at the giant wizard, entranced. After a beat, she moves on.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTY
dialogues.text: That's Wizzy. He’ll protect us. It’s safe.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Yeah, Wizzy’s a protector! Come on! Jancey continues to follow her two new friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk by a boarded-up old castle attraction.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: That’s an old castle. Many battles must’ve happened there once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three kids walk past a thrift store. Jancey looks ahe and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They approach a structure that looks like a giant ice cre cone alongside the highway.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: And THIS is where you get free ice cream.

dialogues.speaker: JANCEY
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three kids beg for change from a TOURIST MOTHER AND DAUGHTER.  17.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Miss? Would you be so kind as to give us your change so we can have cones too?

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTY
dialogues.text: Hopefully one day we can make enough money and then pay you back. The mother fishes for some change in her purse. SCOOTY (CONT’D) The doctor said we gotta eat ice cream right away.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Yeah, we have cancer and need ice cream. Jancey is in awe of the con job taking place before her e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonee, Scooty and Jancey walk by a group of HOMELESS liv in boxes outside a boarded-up Medical Center.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Here is where the homeless people live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonee, Scooty and Jancey share a cone as they approach t Magic Castle. Moonee pops the last bite in her mouth, the stops herself. Moonee passes the last piece to Jancey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonee and Scooty continue to give Jancey their tour into grounds of The Magic Castle. They stop and point at every door. The sequence will play as if we are condensing a documented tour with jump cuts between every line of dialogue.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTY
dialogues.text: 216 is Abigahil. She’s a nice woman with lots of pillows. And sells drugs sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And 217 is a family that has a brother who stabbed someone on Valentine’s Day. The kids pass the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And nobody ever uses the elevator cause it smells like pee. The kids round a corner.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTY
dialogues.text: And 222 is a family that fights like all day.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: And the woman who lives in here thinks she’s married to Jesus. 18. They approach the laundry room. Bertha is exiting the uti room and enters the laundry room.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTY
dialogues.text: And that’s Bertha. She smokes weeds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby is at his computer when the power goes off. The lig monitors and the hum of the air conditioning cut out.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Aw... shit.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ‘The shit just happened? Bobby sits in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The electricity is shut off across entire motel. Bobby exits the lobby door. He’s pissed. WIDE SHOT, LONG TAKE of the entire East wing of the motel This allows us to see many of the motel’s residents filte out of their rooms in anger. (Gloria, RICO the Pool Guy, CUBBY, Haley, Ashley + Troy + 30 BACKGROUND)  19. Bobby continues to walk rapidly toward the back of the building trying to defuse the situation. We see Moonee, Scooty and Jancey hastily enter room 323. We hold on the complaining residents. A few take the opportunity to chill out and light up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby enters the small room and sees a thrown switch. He flips it back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The electricity goes back on and Bobby makes his way back outside as the residents CHEER. Bobby waves to the residents, triumphantly.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Drama’s over. You can all go back to your rooms now, folks. Have a nice day. People filter back inside the rooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amber is behind the counter trying to calm down THREE ANN RESIDENTS, one of them is Gloria.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: Totally unacceptable! I pay good fuckin’ money for my room and that includes A.C.-- ya know what I mean by A.C.? A Cunt. As in you are a cunt! Bobby enters the lobby. He’s pissed. He beelines to the b office.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: Bound to happen at least once this summer. Everyone’s blasting their AC. Then you got microwaves, hot plates... fucking crock pots. These rooms weren’t designed to be extended stay suites.  20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby is reviewing the CCTV as we hear Amber continuing t try to calm down the residents. He squints at one of the camera feeds.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Amber? Amber enters the office.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Wasn’t crock pots. He points to the CCTV monitor. On one of the feeds is an image of Bertha leaving the utility room... and in come t little bodies entering and pulling the switch.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby exits the lobby, fast. He walks up the stairs and pauses at Bertha pushing her cart on the walkway.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Bertha, you leave that utility room unlocked again and you're gone. And don’t think I don’t know what you're doing in there. Bobby makes a “smoking weed” gesture.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: None of that on the premises, comprende? He continues to the third floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halley is sitting on the bed smoking a blunt. Huddled nex her are Moonee, Scooty and Jancey. They are playing a gam the iPad. A LOUD KNOCK at the door. The kids look at each other.  21.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Halley. Open the door. Halley looks over at the three kids. They look guilty.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: (even-keeled) Fuckin’ A. What did you do now? She snubs out the blunt and grabs a can of air freshener blasts the air.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Halley, open up, now. Halley gets off the bed and approaches the door, pissed.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: (whispering to Jancey) Don’t act guilty. Halley opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I have a video of the kids illegally entering the utilities closet and pulling the power.

dialogues.speaker: JANCEY
dialogues.text: They told me that I could be part of the club if I did it. Halley laughs -- causing Moonee and Scooty to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: That’s lit.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Funny right? Happens again and you're gone. Second week of summer and there’s already been a dead fish in the pool--

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: It was an experiment. We were trying to bring it back to life!  22.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: ...and water balloons at some tourists. You don’t mess with tourists.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTY
dialogues.text: They didn’t tip us!

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Damn non-tippers!

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: (turns to Bobby) Oh God. Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Quite serious.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: My God. This is unacceptable. Bobby realizes she is being facetious.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’ve failed as a mother. Moonee, you've disgraced me! Halley bursts into a laughing fit that causes Moonee, Sco and Jancey to join in with giggles.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Don’t fuck with me right now, Halley.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Kids having fun. C’mon bro.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Yeah, so, I lost three hours of work. Work. You know what that is? Halley laughs.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And I'm talking to Ashley, by the way. If your friend leaves you in charge of her kid, he becomes your responsibility and you ain’t taking responsibility. And this one, isn’t she from FutureLand?

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Oh whatevs. You gotta relax, man.  23.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You gonna redo my expense reports with your whatevs? Your kid just killed my night. I wanted to watch the game. You gonna pay me for the three hours I gotta work later?

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Hey guys, pay the man for his three hours.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: I don’t have any money.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTY
dialogues.text: I don’t have any money.

dialogues.speaker: JANCEY
dialogues.text: I have fourteen cents.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: We only has fourteen cents. You’re shit outta luck.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Speaking of... I haven’t gotten this week’s rent from you.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: You don’t think I know that. She closes the door. Bobby stands outside their door and breathing exercises to calm down.

dialogues.speaker: JANCEY
dialogues.text: I think I want to go home now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby and JACK (28) are wrapping a mattress in plastic.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Well, the purple looks nice. How much did that put you all back?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Narek spent 20K on it.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: And he can’t afford an exterminator?  24.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Here. Bobby hands Jack duct tape. Jack rips a strip and seals t plastic. Bobby stops him.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No, Jack, I told you! Longer strips.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Then you do it.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I was just saying, you know better, you have to use longer strips. C'mon. They continue to seal the mattress. Jack is focused on th job and barely notices Moonee and Scooty as they peer in.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Whatcha doin?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Top secret work.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTY
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Guys, I need you outta here.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: You guys are boring anyway.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: That's right. See you later. The kids run off. Bobby and Jack continues to work in silence. Eventually Bobby begins removing the headboard.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Oh, worse than I thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby and Jack throw the sealed mattress in the dumpster. words are spoken between them.  25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonee and Scooty sit in the lobby licking dripping ice c cones. Their faces are covered with melted ice cream. We reveal that Bobby has been watching them intently. Arm crossed, leaning against the counter. Scooty's melting cone breaks apart and a piece hits the floor.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Okay, out! I warned you. One drop and you’re out. Now out.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Oh come on!

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTY
dialogues.text: It’s gonna melt outside!

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Obviously it’s melting inside too. The two kids exit the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonee and Scooty lounge in the enclave, remnants of ice cream all over their faces. Something grabs Scooty's attention...

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTY
dialogues.text: Gloria! Gloria is strutting towards the pool with a towel ina bikini. EXT. FUTURELAND INN - JANCEY’S ROOM - DAY Moonee/Scooty pound on Jancey’s door, winded and panickin Dicky has joined the group. Grandma Stacy answers.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA STACY
dialogues.text: Hey, one light knock will do.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE AND SCOOTY
dialogues.text: We need Jancey!!!  26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonee/Scooty/Jancey/Dicky run onto the second floor balc and perch over the castle battlement to look down at the area -- Gloria sunbathes topless. The kids giggle as they spy on chanting “Boobies, boobies, boobies!” Bobby eventually saunters into the pool area.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Gloria, cover it up, please. I’ve told you this before. Thank you. Gloria resists.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: These kids don’t need a health class right now.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: Kids are in school, honey.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: They're right there. (pointing) It’s summer break, Gloria.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me? She stands up, revealing her chest in all its glory.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You gonna stand there and give me shit about these? Are these making you uncomfortable, Bobby?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Cover it up. Thank you. The kids laugh and chant while Gloria continues to protes Finally Gloria covers up. The kids are upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the driveway of The Magic Castle, Jancey and Dicky are walking home. Moonee and Scooty slip into the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: DICKY
dialogues.text: I better get home before I get grounded again.  27. PATRICE (30's), the Magic Castle night manager, rolls up steps out of his BEAT-UP CAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrice enters, nods to Bobby. Moonee and Scooty are whistling into a fan.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTY
dialogues.text: I can’t whistle. Scooty makes an annoying sound into the fan.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICE
dialogues.text: Kids. Out. Patrice passes Amber wrapping things up behind the desk. Amber begins packing up and getting ready to go.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: Yeah. Bobby is sitting at the desk, tending to emails. He never looks away from the screen.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICE
dialogues.text: Hey, boss.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Narek will be in next week so we just need to take care of the invoices tonight, oh and do me a favor, put in that paint order, will ya? That tower needs touch- ups.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: And that effing ice machine has been out of order for three months.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Yeah, fix that effing ice machine!

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTY
dialogues.text: We need ice! People need ice.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: That thing can’t be fixed. I'll deal with it. (to Patrice) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just talk to him about the re- order. Thank you. Oh, and keep your eyes on 151. There’s been traffic in and out all day. Patrice studies Bobby for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICE
dialogues.text: Are you... Bobby, that room’s been hot all week. I thought you were letting ‘em slide? Patrice lights his candle. Bobby just stares. He rubs his face.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I'll take care of it tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby leaves the lobby... he walks three steps and enters closest motel room to the office -- Room 101. He slams th door to his home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amber leaves.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: Have a great fucking night. Patrice settles behind the counter.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICE
dialogues.text: What did I say? Get outta here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halley, Ashley, Moonee and Scooty sit on the stairs. Moon plays a game on the iPad while Halley and Ashley listen t hip-hop on their phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside Room 151, Bobby is watching a couple packing up a leaving.

dialogues.speaker: DEALER GIRL
dialogues.text: This is fucked up, son.  29.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Don’t want to hear it. Let’s go.

dialogues.speaker: DEALER GIRL
dialogues.text: I paid for the week, man. I want a refund.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Get the fuck outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonee and Scooty sit on the steps of the front stairwell near the lobby. They are lit by the sodium-vapour lamps t illuminate the parking lot. In the background, residents the motel are out on their balconies socializing. A TAXI pulls into the parking lot. Moonee/Scooty perk up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrice takes the candle out of his bag and searches for lighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cab parks under the awning outside the lobby. A CABBI (50), shocked HUBBY (40) and confused WIFE (30) exit the

dialogues.speaker: HUBBY
dialogues.text: Wait, hold on, Sir. I think you got the wrong place.

dialogues.speaker: CABBIE
dialogues.text: This is the address you gave me.

dialogues.speaker: WIFE
dialogues.text: (Portuguese) What did he say? The driver removes luggage from the back of the taxi.

dialogues.speaker: HUBBY
dialogues.text: Wait, I think we have a problem here. This isn’t where we are staying. Moonee and Scooty approach. The wife looks at them.  30.

dialogues.speaker: CABBIE
dialogues.text: Well, you want to check that address?

dialogues.speaker: WIFE
dialogues.text: (Portuguese) We are going to the Magic Kingdom... you said you booked a hotel at the Magic Kingdom. That everything was taken care of. What is this place? We are not even on Disney property.

dialogues.speaker: HUBBY
dialogues.text: (Portuguese) Shit. I mean... Joao booked it for me. I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: WIFE
dialogues.text: (Portuguese) You had your assistant book our honeymoon hotel? Are you fucking kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO a conversation already in progress between our Hub and Patrice. The Husband has his phone to his ear. Moonee Scooty are watching. The Cabbie is smoking a cigarette outside.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICE
dialogues.text: (into walkie talkie) Bobby, can you help me out in here? Patrice turns back to the husband.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can give you the AAA rate, how about that?

dialogues.speaker: HUBBY
dialogues.text: No. No no, I am not asking for a discount.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICE
dialogues.text: Well I’ve already said, because you booked it online, if you want a refund you have to do it online, you'll get it back on your statement within 2-3 weeks. The husband hangs up the phone and turns to his wife.  31.

dialogues.speaker: HUBBY
dialogues.text: (Portuguese) He’s not answering. (to Patrice in English) No, you don’t understand. I don’t care about a refund. We just need a place to stay.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICE
dialogues.text: And you got a place to stay. You have room 325.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: That’s two rooms down from my room! Bobby enters the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: What’s up? (to kids) You two. Out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cabbie impatiently smokes his cigarette. The kids sta through the window.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTY
dialogues.text: That lady is pretty.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Yeah. But... I think she’s going to cry. I can always tell when adults are about to cry. The cabbie opens the door of the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: CABBIE
dialogues.text: Hey man. I’m going to have to charge you waiting time. I got other calls.

dialogues.speaker: WIFE
dialogues.text: (Portuguese) What is he saying? The husband is overwhelmed.

dialogues.speaker: HUBBY
dialogues.text: Wait, Sir. I'll get the new address. Hold on.  32.

dialogues.speaker: CABBIE
dialogues.text: Hey, look, just call the company when you're ready, it’s a busy weekend for us. I’m losing fares. The cabbie snubs the cigarette and enters the lobby. We s that he is settling the bill with the husband as the kids watch through the glass. Moonee eyes the luggage and then looks to Scooty. He nods winks. The two kids grab the couple’s luggage and move it into the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cabbie exits and drives away. The husband is busy on phone, scouring the internet.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: It’s almost midnight, one of the busiest weekends of the year around here. The only other room you’1l find tonight is another single somewhere along this stretch. Take your pick.

dialogues.speaker: HUBBY
dialogues.text: Listen, do you see my wife there? She's Brazilian. They LOVE this place. She’s been coming here since she was a kid and her dream was to have her honeymoon in Disney.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: You just got married? Wife notices kids have taken the luggage inside.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Listen, trust me. If I brought my girl to this place on our honeymoon, she would have divorced my ass. I feel for you. But what do you want me to do, fella?

dialogues.speaker: WIFE
dialogues.text: (very broken English) Hey! Get away from that!

dialogues.speaker: PATRICE
dialogues.text: They're just trying to get a tip.  33.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: You can’t leave stuff out there.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTY
dialogues.text: Yeah, there’s punks out there.

dialogues.speaker: WIFE
dialogues.text: (Portuguese) What are these stray children rummaging about? This is a welfare, slum motel. We’re spending our honeymoon in a gypsy project? Find another place. Check The Polynesian first. Or Grand Floridian. Maybe The Contemporary but only Bay Lake Tower!

dialogues.speaker: HUBBY
dialogues.text: (Portuguese) I'm checking, okay? This is their independence holiday. Very popular. The resorts are booked. The wife begins to cry. Moonee looks over at Scooty.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Told ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonee and Scooty sit in their favorite spot once again.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTY
dialogues.text: Hey, you wanna see something cool?

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Of course!

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTY
dialogues.text: Make sure you don’t tell anyone. Scooty whips out a lighter he took from Patrice. SCOOTY (CONT’D) It has a naked lady on it! Moonee gasps! Halley yells down from upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Moonee!

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: What, Mom!?!  34.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Get off your butts and go get some waffles!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonee/Scooty pick up food from the back of Waffle Home. Ashley hands Scooty a doggy bag, she notices how filthy t two kids are.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: You have shit all over your face, get over here. She proceeds to wipe off both of their faces with her apr

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Oh, my mom wanted extra maple syrup. Moonee smiles as Ashley loads up the bag. Moonee whispers Scooty’s ear.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s actually for me. Scooty joins her in a giggle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonee/Scooty/Halley once again eat their food picnic-sty Moonee drowns her waffle with the extra syrup. Silent eating. Wind blows through their hair. Halley is focused on her smartphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halley haggles with a PERFUME WHOLESALER while Moonee tri out samples.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Can I get a discount if I buy over twenty?

dialogues.speaker: PERFUME WHOLESALER
dialogues.text: Umm... this is wholesale. Halley pays cash and leaves with a bag full of sealed box of perfume.  35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halley and Moonee attempt to sell perfume to HOTEL GUESTS Moonee puts on her best “cute face.” (Shot “candid camera”-style with a hidden camera. Actors attempt to sell perfume to real pedestrians.)

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: Excuse me. We are selling perfume. Would you like to help my daughter and I and buy a bottle? They smell great.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: These will make you smell like Justin Bieber!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby is behind the counter with Amber. Magic Castle Owne NAREK (50's) is reading reviews on his phone.

dialogues.speaker: NAREK
dialogues.text: ...what does “rachet” even mean? Listen, Amber, you need to tell everybody you know, I need better Yelp reviews. Not just Yelp. Expedia, Priceline, all those. I need five-star reviews. This is killing me.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: Why don’t you offer the residents like a discount to give a good review.

dialogues.speaker: NAREK
dialogues.text: That’s not a bad idea. I like that. Something catches Bobby’s eye. He looks up. It’s Halley, headed straight for the office. “What shitstorm will this now” is written all over Bobby’s face. Halley enters and marches up to the counter.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Oh, sorry to interrupt. I just wanted to pay you for the week, Sir. $240. Halley plops down two hundreds and two twenties.  36.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Our stay has been delightful so far. The pool temperature is perfection. Have a great day. Halley exits. Amber counts the cash.

dialogues.speaker: NAREK
dialogues.text: Did you see these fake reviews The Wishing Star has? That woman was murdered there last month. No way anyone in their right mind is giving that shithole four stars.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: I kinda miss counting $240 in singles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Narek and Bobby walk and talk, passing RESIDENTS and CURI KIDS. Moonee, Scooty and Jancey watch the adults from the stairs. Scooty is playing with the lighter. Narek points to the bikes locked onto the railings on the second and t floors.

dialogues.speaker: NAREK
dialogues.text: Okay, see? That’s finable now. Make a flyer. Put it under the doors. It should say they have to remove the bikes and lock ‘em in the back. If there are any bikes remaining on the rails we’re going to cut them on August first. Got it?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Yes. Watching from overhead, Moonee let’s out a sigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonee/Scooty/Jancey and other kids watch as Dicky and hi Dad move out. Their old station wagon is packed to the br Dicky’s Dad throws some stuff in to the dumpster and give toys away to Moonee, Jancey, Scooty and the rest. DICKY’S DAD Dicky, wanna say bye to your room? Dicky shakes his head, he doesn’t look happy that his 99- store knock-off Woody and Buzz toys are being given away.  37. DICKY’S DAD (CONT’D) I told you, New Orleans, new toys. There’s not an extra inch in this thing. Let’s get rolling. Dicky walks over to his friends.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: My mom says to say good-bye.

dialogues.speaker: DICKY
dialogues.text: Well, see ya around, I guess. The kids hug and fist-bump him good-bye. Moonee seems indifferent. She’s been through this before. Never good t get too emotional over anyone. Like her mom taught her. Dicky’s father gives the kids a cardboard box of remainin toys and bric-a-brac. The kids wave and watch as the car leaves the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonee, Scooty and Jancey split an ice cream outside the Twistee Treat. Moonee holds the cone and passes it to her friends.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: One lick for you... (to Jancey) one lick for you... (to Scooty)and one lick for me... (Moonee licks again) two licks for you... (to Jancey)... two licks for you... (to Scooty) and one, two licks for me (Moonee licks twice).

dialogues.speaker: TWISTEE TREAT EMPLOYEE
dialogues.text: Hey. Hey! You guys can’t hang out there. Seriously. You can’t sit there. The kids don’t move an inch.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTY
dialogues.text: We're paying customers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halley is wearing a bathing suit. She grabs a towel and passes by the sleeping Moonee. She exits.  38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halley and Ashley are in the pool. They smoke and drink a laugh. They converse about the kids and their single stat Bobby is making his nightly rounds.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Girls, you know very well that night swimming is a no-go.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Did you just say no-go? The women laugh.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: Wanna go skinny dipping, Bobby? Bobby gives up and continues on his patrol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two women return to their respective rooms.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: Good night, bitch. I love you.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Love you, bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonee/Jancey/Scooty/Mia/Jazlyn/Other Kids play in the playground. Two dogs, BUNSEN and BOONEE, frolic with the kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halley and Moonee eat a cheese pizza on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Where’s the iPad?

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Sold.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: What?  39.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Had to sell it.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: But why?

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Whatever, Moonee. This room costs money. Moonee is disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: You know I like pepperoni.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Pepperoni costs money. The two sit in silence while watching the TV. Halley side eyes her daughter. She knows the Moonee is upset. Halley gets off the bed and grabs a bag of gummy bears.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But look... She sprinkles gummy bears onto the pie.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We got gummy bear pizza! Moonee loves it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halley pulls out a wad of cash and hands it to Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Seriously, if you’re going to be late again, you got to let me know.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: It was due yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Yeah, exactly, it was due yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Whatevs. Bobby counts the cash. Halley exits.  40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quarter of a mile up Route 192 is a fenced-off set of pastel-colored condos, weather-damaged and abandoned. Moonee, Scooty and Jancey ignore the “Private Property: D Not Enter” sign. Jancey looks concerned.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: C’mon. This is gonna be a haunted scary adventure.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTY
dialogues.text: Yeah, there’s ghosts in there.

dialogues.speaker: JANCEY
dialogues.text: Ghosts?! They run around the exteriors of the dilapidated condos.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTY
dialogues.text: And there are killer gators in there that chase pirates! Scooty points to the water as Jancey moves away from it. They enter the condos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peeling paint, water damage, collapsed ceilings and floor all results of the hurricane back in ‘08. Scooty jumps out and tries to scare the girls, pretending be a ghost of these “haunted” buildings.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Someday we’ll live in a place this big.

dialogues.speaker: JANCEY
dialogues.text: Can I come over and play?

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Of course, Jancey! And this is where my bed will be. Moonee points to different sections of the empty space.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No, I‘ll put my bed there and that’s where my toys will go there.  4l. Scooty runs off to another room and has fun breaking some windows, throwing debris from the second floor, etc. Moonee and Jancey break away from Scooty. Moonee approach fireplace filled with debris.

dialogues.speaker: JANCEY
dialogues.text: I never lived in a house that had a fireplace.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Well, you do now! Wait! I got the bestest idea!

dialogues.speaker: JANCEY
dialogues.text: You do?

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Scooty! We need your lighter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonee and Jancey watch as Scooty gets his lighter to spa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonee, Jancey and Scooty run down the side of Route 192 the lawn of FutureLand.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTY
dialogues.text: We’re in so much trouble!

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: No, it'll be okay. We just have to pretend we weren’t there! Jancey veers off and Moonee/Scooty keep running.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (yelling to Jancey) Don’ t-tell-anyone-Jancey-okay-see- ya-Jjust-—go-home-no-one-say-a-word- okay-later-k-bye!

dialogues.speaker: JANCEY
dialogues.text: (screaming) Okay!

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTY
dialogues.text: Hurry!  42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonee and Scooty run down the balcony to their respectiv rooms as residents exit their rooms and look to the sky. Someone calls 9-1-1, some panic, some are excited but everyone rushes to the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amber peeks around the corner of the back office.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: Yo, I need help out here. Bobby exits the back office.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: What’s going on? A family of three is checking in: NEW GIRL (11), NEW BOY and NEW FATHER (35) are standing in front of the counter. Father is deaf and being assisted by his daughter. Amber motions to the guest registration sheet.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: I can’t explain it any better than I already have. The address thing.

dialogues.speaker: NEW GIRL
dialogues.text: My father doesn’t understand what he did wrong.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Let me see. Oh, yeah. No problem. Just initial here. States that the address on your ID is your permanent address. New Girl and New Boy turn to the father and translate in language. He speaks back to them in sign language.

dialogues.speaker: NEW GIRL
dialogues.text: He says he told her that that’s our old address.  43.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Yes, so, is there a new permanent address? The kids turn and translate. The father replies.

dialogues.speaker: NEW GIRL
dialogues.text: He says he wouldn’t be moving his family into a motel if we had a permanent address.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Tell him I’m trying to help him here. Legally I can’t rent a room if you’re homeless.

dialogues.speaker: NEW GIRL
dialogues.text: Well, we’re not homeless. Bobby raises his eyebrows.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: And that’s exactly what my boss wants to hear... so writing down a permanent address will help with that. Got me? Again, the kids translate. All the while, residents are running by the lobby windows. It’s distracting to Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Excuse me a second. Bobby walks to the doors as Amber takes over the check-in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perplexed, Bobby steps out of the lobby to watch the exci residents running toward Route 192. He notices a huge clo of black smoke in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door is open and Ashley watches the residents leave t parking lot. She is excited about seeing the fire.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: C’mon, Scooty... don’t you wanna see the burning house?

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTY
dialogues.text: No, it’s okay. I’m just going to watch TV. She knows something is wrong.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: Scooty. Please tell me you didn’t have anything to do with this?

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTY
dialogues.text: No. I didn’t.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: Scooty. Don’t fuck with me right now. If you did this, I’m in so much trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Halley and Moonee at the end of the walkway.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Hurry your ass, bitch. I don’t want to miss this. Ashley leans out of her door.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: I’1l meet you there.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Okay, hurry, bitch! Halley and Moonee take off.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: You tell me the truth right now. You understand what will happen to us if you did this? You want the fuckin’ DCF down here, Scooty?! Ashley is starting to lose it, scaring Scooty.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTY
dialogues.text: I didn’t do it. Moonee and Jancey did it. Ashley gets in Scooty’s face.  45.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: And how do you know that? Were you there, Scooty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The excited CROWD watches as FIREFIGHTERS attempt to put the inferno. A crowd of ONLOOKERS are pumped and very voc Halley is offered a beer by some guys. She accepts. Fun a around. The fire is put out against the purple dusk sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gloria is smoking outside the front lobby as Bobby walks

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You got another one of those?

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA
dialogues.text: For you? Why not. Bobby lights up. Bobby sits down as Gloria stares at the remaining smoke fading into the red sky.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Could’ve been arson. Bobby shrugs, looks down.

dialogues.speaker: GLORIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They were so fucking ugly I was thinking of burning them down!

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Nobody said anything right? Jancey and Scooty confirm.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, good. Manhunt! Moonee, Jancey and Scooty play Hide & Seek. Scooty begins counting as the girls run away.  46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonee and Jancey run into the office and hide under the desk. They are forced to be very close to one another... to Bobby’s feet.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Even though you have your boots laced up, I can still smell your stinky feet. They smell, right? Jancey giggles. Bobby rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: These stinky feet are going to kick you in the face if you don’t shut up. And please go outside. Jancey starts to get up. Moonee stops her.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: We're hiding. This is serious.

dialogues.speaker: JANCEY
dialogues.text: Bobby, you should probably buy some Dr. Scholls or talcum powder. Scooty runs in.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTY
dialogues.text: (to Amber) You see Moonee and Jancey? Amber points to the back office. Scooty runs to the back. Bobby points to under the desk.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: (to Bobby) Oh man! C’mon!

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTY
dialogues.text: (to Bobby and Amber) You guys aren’t supposed to tell me!

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (doesn’t care) G’bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jancey is counting on the bottom of the front stairs. Scooty and Moonee run up the stairs to hide and run into livid Ashley. Ashley grabs Scooty and drags him away.  47.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: You think I was joking? I told you, you ain’t playing with those two anymore. Moonee is perplexed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huge BRAWL with 5 BRAWLERS and 10 BRAWL WATCHERS in the middle of the parking lot. Moonee watches from the 3rd floor balcony with Halley. Halley, smoking a blunt, CHEERS ON the violence. She look down to the second floor balcony and sees Ashley watching

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Yo, Ash, you believe this shit!? Ashley looks up, acknowledges, does not answer.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bitch, what’s good? Ashley has retreated to her room.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ‘Fucks wrong with her? A car SPINS OUT and RUNS OVER one of the brawlers. The cr goes crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby, in boxers and a T-shirt, stands outside room 101 watching the car fly by. He calls 911.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flashing police lights illuminate the interior. 4 POLICE OFFICERS are standing outside the office asking questions residents. A previously-seen resident is complaining to an officer t they should have left the kids alone and let the fight continue. Bobby and Patrice watch on.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICE
dialogues.text: What was I supposed to do?  48.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: No more checking in parties larger than five unless it’s a family. No more open containers of alcohol outside the rooms. No more kids hanging up in the stairwell. And how ‘bout this? How ‘bout no more letting people run over other people in the fucking parking lot? How ‘bout that?

dialogues.speaker: PATRICE
dialogues.text: I couldn't do anything, Room 217 joined in before I even got out! The kids are fascinated with the officers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Continuation of the “candid camera” style. Halley and Moo attempt to sell more perfume to pedestrians. Moonee sells just as hard as her mother. After one too many rejections, Halley asks a GOLFER if he could spare a couple of bucks. The man hands over a few singles. Halley is distracted from a perfume sale, she turns to se SECURITY GUARD approaching in a gold cart. She grabs Moon and begins to walk swiftly out of the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Hey! Come back!

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: It’s fine. We’re leaving.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: I need you to come with me. Halley speeds up the pace, pulling Moonee. SECURITY GUARD (CONT’D) You hear me? You were soliciting.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: You’re not a real cop.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: You can’t do that on our property. Police are on the way and I need to confiscate that.  49. A tug of war over the bag of perfume ends in the entire b exploding onto the pavement.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Fuck! You fucking bitch! Halley grabs Moonee and drags her away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halley is stressed, but then attempts to keep the mood fu having Moonee hop on her back. Halley attempts to suppres tears as she walks Moonee back toward Magic Castle.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Why did we let her have our perfume?

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: It’s complicated, baby.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: But why?

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Just c’mon.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: But we just left all our stuff there?

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: I can’t get arrested again, Moonee! Now come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonee and Jancey approach Waffle Home. Moonee motions fo Ashley to meet them out back in a humorous way. Ashley asks a CO-WORKER to help her with an order and goe the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ashley opens the back door.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: Moonee, tell your mom, I can’t be giving away food, okay?  50.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Oh, okay, well, is Scooty here?

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Oh... he’s not at home.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: He’s at my friend's.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Oh. Well, it’s Jancey’s birthday and we wanted to know if Scooty--

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: You can’t come around here no more, okay? I don’t want you playing with Scooty anymore, got it? Moonee leaves, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haley, Moonee and Jancey walking down Magic Castle drivew

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: You sure Scooty don’t want to come?

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: That’s what Ashley said.

dialogues.speaker: HALEY
dialogues.text: Ashley said what?

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: That they’re not coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halley is hitchhiking. Moonee and Jancey stand next to he Jancey seems a bit confused why they’re on the side of th road so close to oncoming traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DRIVER, a clean-cut man in his upper 20’s who is clea on his way to work at Magic Kingdom looks in his rear vie mirror, having second thoughts if picking up these three a good idea.  51. Halley leans over and changes the radio from a local stat playing a 1982 EPCOT Center instrumental track to a rap station. Halley is very excited to hear “BOSS ASS BITCH”. Halley begins to rap along with it. Moonee joins in. Eventually, Jancey joins as well on the most explicit lyr

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Okay right up here is good.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: This is a dead end...

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Yep. Thanks, dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three step into a clearing at the end of the road in middle of nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: This is as close as we can get.

dialogues.speaker: JANCEY
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Shhh! Just follow us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three sitting on the grass in the dark. The sodium-va light them from above. Halley pulls two 99-cent-store no- brand cans of soda and a 40-ounce malt liquor from her ba The kids drink their soda, Halley smokes and drinks her 4

dialogues.speaker: JANCEY
dialogues.text: But why are we in the middle of nowhere in the night?

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Shhhh! You'll see. FIREWORKS explode overhead. Jancey is in complete awe fro the explosions of magic. Moonee smiles. Halley is excited  52.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Happy birthday to you! Make a wish, big girl.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Happy birthday, Jancey.

dialogues.speaker: JANCEY
dialogues.text: Wow! Jancey blows out a candle on a cupcake.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Did you make a birthday wish?

dialogues.speaker: JANCEY
dialogues.text: Of course! The finale is spectacular, it’s cacophony of lights, soun and colors bouncing off Jancey and Moonee’s pie-eyed face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonee watches Jerry Springer while Halley is waking up w a hangover.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Go run and get some Waffle Home, baby. And where the fuck is Scooty?

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: I’m not allowed there anymore. And Scooty is with that family in 246. Extreme delayed response. Looooooong Beat.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halley knocks hard on the door. ROOM 246 FATHER answers. Scooty sits on the bed with a 4 year-old ROOM 246 LITTLE GIRL.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Hey, Halley. Halley looks inside and address Scooty.  53.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Moonee’s gonna hit the pool, you wanna come hang?

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Ashley doesn’t think that’s a good idea right now, so--

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: ‘The fuck does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: ROOM 246 FATHER
dialogues.text: Okay, Halley... let’s not go there. ROOM 246 MOTHER walks over.

dialogues.speaker: ROOM 246 MOTHER
dialogues.text: We don’t need your drama.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: You haven’t seen me get dramatic, bitch.

dialogues.speaker: ROOM 246 MOTHER
dialogues.text: You define drama queen, bitch.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: What did Ashley say about me? Halley ignores the mother’s attempt to shut down the conversation and continues to create drama. The mother sl the door on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halley marches into Waffle Home with Moonee. She sits dow and Ashley’s co-worker comes over to take the order.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: (points to Ashley) Sorry, but can she take our order? The co-worker recognizes Moonee and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CO-WORKER
dialogues.text: Oh, it’s you. Never seen you inside before. Okay, hold on. The co-worker approaches Ashley and gestures to Halley. Ashley approaches the table.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: Yeah.  54.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: How can I help you, Halley?

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Moonee’s been telling me she ain't welcome here anymore.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: She’s allowed to come into the establishment, but I can’t be giving any more food out.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Oh shit, you get in trouble?

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: And I don’t want Scooty hanging out with her or that new kid from FutureLand anymore.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Okay, so you ain’t in trouble. What’s goin’ on then?

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: Nothing. Nothing to discuss.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: Really. Ashley begins to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Yo. What type of service is that. You going to take our order? Ashley takes out her order pad.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Moonee, order whatever the fuck you want.  55.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Yes! I would like a strawberry waffle with extra warm syrup and eggs and bacon and more strawberries. And blueberries. And coke. Two of ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: That’s it? You could order more.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Extra bacon. And extra, extra syrup.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: You got money for all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bunch of empty plates and mugs surround little Moonee. Halley looks over to Ashley.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: You wanna have a burping contest? Moonee’s eyes light up. She lets out a huge BELCH.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whoa, nice one. Ashley slaps the bill on the table. Halley lifts up the b and looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want the rest to go. Ashley brings a container and bag to the table and begins turn away.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ya gonna pack this for us or do I call Waffle Home Central and tell them what I think of one of their employees? Ashley packs the containers. All sides are humiliated. Moonee, oblivious, finishes the last of her waffle.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Say hi to Scooty for me.  56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halley is dragging Moonee home with one hand along the si of US-192. Halley is walking way too fast. In an act of rage, Halley chucks the bags into the middle oncoming traffic. A car SCREECHES. From OFF-SCREEN, an ANGRY DRIVER screams at Halley who returns a middle finger over her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Mom! Why did you do that? Halley holds back tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonee and Halley are in their room. Hip Hop plays from t phone. Halley is changing into a bikini.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Bobby says we can’t go night swimming.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Well first off, screw Bobby. Second, we’re not going swimming... we're going to take swimsuit selfies!

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Swimsuit selfies! Moonee gets excited. She changes into a bathing suit as w

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Swimsuit selfies! That’s right! You take some of me then I’1l take you.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Okay! Moonee grabs the phone and takes some shots of her mom po in various sexy poses.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Wait, hold up. Halley carefully removes the pictures of her with Moonee the bathroom mirror behind her.  57.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, now. Ready.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: You know, selfies are actually when you take photos of yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bright daylight. A CHURCH GROUP is handing out bagged loa of white bread to various families. Bobby and Magic Castl Owner Narek stand and watch from a distance. A VICTIM of domestic abuse stands in line.

dialogues.speaker: NAREK
dialogues.text: Do they have to do it right here? Guests come right through here, for Christ's sake, Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Guys, can we move the van to the back, please? Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH VOLUNTEER
dialogues.text: Of course, no problem, Bobby. Moonee shoves her way through the line of people.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Coming through.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH VOLUNTEER
dialogues.text: Hi, what would you like? Moonee points to some bread.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: I want that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonee plays by herself in the bathtub. A cheap radio sit on the top of the toilet blasts some hip-hop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a MONTAGE sequence, Bobby watches as Moonee and her daughter make a bunch of trips from their room to a VACAN MOTEL ROOM (being used as a storage room) located near th office. Halley becomes more and more belligerent by carrying les items on every trip, dragging out the process.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby is carrying three large plastic bags full of clothe behind Halley and Moonee.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You know the deal. No reason to express your opinion about it.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: I have an idea. Why don’t you just say we did this.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I’m not going through this again. The sooner you’re out, the sooner you're back in. Let’s go.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: I don’t understand why we got to even do this, it’s stupid.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I’m not going to explain this to you every time, Halley... I’m not letting you establish residency. Don’t think I think you’re as dumb as you want me to think. You’1l fuck me. You don’t want to do it then you can go.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: But who will know if we do this or not? Bobby points upwards to one of the many CCTV’s.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: And I'm being serious right now... I'm being straight with you... you have to square up by Friday.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: You need to get laid, son. C’mon, Moonee.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: See you in twenty four hours.  59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halley and Moonee exit the Magic Castle driveway and walk the motel directly across 192...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halley, holding her duffel bag, stands in front of the Arabian Nights manager JIMMY (Male, 40’s). Moonee waits w her backpack.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Hey hey. It’s that time of the month. The manager smirks, obviously familiar with Halley. He be taking out the paperwork to check her in.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Forty five, my dear.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Forty five? No no. I come here one night a month and the rate is thirty five.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: One night is forty five.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: But the Magic Castle discount...

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: (motions over his shoulder) I know. I know. The new owner is not honoring the discount.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Not honoring my fuckin’ ass. Oh, owner! Owner, will you come out here please? The ARABIAN NIGHTS OWNER, a South Asian Woman, enters fro the back office.

dialogues.speaker: OWNER
dialogues.text: Is everything alright here?  60.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Everything is not alright. I’m right across the way at Magic Castle. I come here once a month and the rate’s $35.

dialogues.speaker: OWNER
dialogues.text: Yes, well, our policy has changed.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: You can’t just change your policy.

dialogues.speaker: OWNER
dialogues.text: I certainly can.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Oh fuck this right now. Halley takes out her phone and dials up Bobby on speaker.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hey Bobby, these fuckos at the Arabian wanna charge me-- She extends her arm out to hold the phone closer to the Owner.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Forty five.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Forty five bucks. Can you tell them it’s thirty five.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Hey, Bobby -- it’s out of my control here.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (on phone) Hey Jimmy. What’s going on? The owner interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: OWNER
dialogues.text: Hello. This is the new owner of Arabian Nights. Any agreements or deals your motel had with the previous owners are no longer being honored or recognized. Thank you.  61.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (on phone) Who's this?

dialogues.speaker: OWNER
dialogues.text: This is the new owner. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (on phone) Okay, but what is your name?

dialogues.speaker: OWNER
dialogues.text: That is not important. We are very busy here. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Busy? This place is empty, Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby crosses Route 192 headed to the Arabian Nights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby enters the lobby. Halley and Moonee are splayed out the couch. Jimmy and the Arabian Nights Owner are behind desk.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Hey, what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Yeah, thought you got the memo. No more discounts for any of the motels. Not just the Castle.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Please to meet you, Ma’am. I’m Bobby Horton, I manage the Magic Castle across the way. There’s been an agreement in place for a while where we give a little break to each other’s tenants for one night for--

dialogues.speaker: OWNER
dialogues.text: I’m well aware of the arrangement you used to have in place with our motel but as I have said five times now this is no longer being honored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Just went through this for The Enchanted Inn.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Can you perhaps just--

dialogues.speaker: OWNER
dialogues.text: This is not up for discussion.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: See what I’m sayin’, Bobby?

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
