dialogues.text: She’s a real dickwad. They all look to Halley, who is holding in laughter.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: What are you lookin’ at me for? She said it. Bobby does a quick breathing exercise. He then whips ten dollar bill from his wallet and slams it down on counter.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: (to Moonee) Magic Castle discount. There ya go. Sleep tight.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Awwww... the feels. You so sweet, Bobby. I’m sorry I was a dickwad to you earlier. 62. out a the Bobby looks at Moonee, to see if she heard her mom say th

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Don't look at me, she said it.

dialogues.speaker: OWNER
dialogues.text: We don’t need your business. All of you kindly leave. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: OWNER
dialogues.text: If you could please leave. Thank you.  63.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: I have the forty five. You can’t do that. Bobby and Jimmy know this is a no-win situation and keep quiet.

dialogues.speaker: OWNER
dialogues.text: Listen to yourself and your child. No wonder you are in this situation. Please leave the property. Halley walks forward and spits at the owner. It gets the intended response. She grabs Moonee and exits into magic hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halley and Moonee approach the motel. INT. FUTURELAND INN - JANCEY’S ROOM - NIGHT Big sleepover with Grandma Stacy/Jancey/Luci/Halley/Moone Much has changed in this room. Grandma Stacy has complete moved her family in, feels more lived-in than Halley’s ro

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Damn, girl, this shit looks fancy in here.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA STACY
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: You an interior decorator or some shit? It’s mad cozy. Little Luci plays in one corner. Jancey shows Moonee some her stuff in another. Grandma Stacy and Halley sit on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Mom, they have so many toys. Why can’t I have this many toys?

dialogues.speaker: JANCEY
dialogues.text: Gramma, if you’ll be in the one bed with Luci then can I be in the other with Moonee and her mom?  64.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA STACY
dialogues.text: Sure, honey.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: (pointing to crock-pot) What’s that?

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA STACY
dialogues.text: What, that? That’s a crock-pot. That’s where I make my rice and peas.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Damn, I have to learn how to cook or something ‘cause those Lunchables hurt Moonee’s stomach.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Lunchables suck.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA STACY
dialogues.text: (nods ) Crock-Pot.

dialogues.speaker: JANCEY
dialogues.text: Gramma, can they sleep here every night?

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: JANCEY
dialogues.text: This is gonna be the bestest funnest sleepover ever.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Since it’s bedtime can we finally go outside and smoke a blunt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby unlocks the storage room for Halley and Moonee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonee, Jancey and Cubby (now with 2 casts on his arms) a playing on the dilapidated swingset. Two dogs, BUNSEN and BOONEE, frolic with the kids. A SUSPICIOUS MAN (70's) approaches.

dialogues.speaker: SUSPICIOUS MAN
dialogues.text: Hi, Kids. Having fun?  65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby is up on a ladder painting the gutter of the third floor walkway. Bobby notices the Suspicious Man speaking the kids down below. A full bucket of purple paint falls almost hits a LUCKY RESIDENT.

dialogues.speaker: LUCKY RESIDENT
dialogues.text: What the fuck, Bobby?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby exits the stairwell and makes a bee-line towards th playground. Lucky Resident wipes paint off himself. Bobby turns and walks towards the playground. The commoti has caused the Suspicious Man to look over and see Bobby approaching. He begins to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Excuse me? Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: SUSPICIOUS MAN
dialogues.text: No, that’s okay.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: What’s okay? You a guest here?

dialogues.speaker: SUSPICIOUS MAN
dialogues.text: Um, no. Just looking for um, a soda machine.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Yeah, come to a motel to get a soda?

dialogues.speaker: SUSPICIOUS MAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, it’s okay. Thanks anyway.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: No, no, no. Follow me.

dialogues.speaker: SUSPICIOUS MAN
dialogues.text: No really, it’s okay. I’1l finda convenience store.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I‘11 show you where the machine is. Come with me. The suspicious man reluctantly follows Bobby.  66.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You parched?

dialogues.speaker: SUSPICIOUS MAN
dialogues.text: Oh yeah.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Got to whet that palate?

dialogues.speaker: SUSPICIOUS MAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. I never did get used to this humidity. They walk by the drying paint. SUSPICIOUS MAN (CONT’D) Looks like you have stuff to tend to here. I'll just go ahead and find it somewhere else.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: No, it’s right over here. Come on. Bobby escorts the nervous old man over to the soda machin near the utility room.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look at those choices. The man stands there nervously.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you waiting for? The man puts coins in the machine and chooses a Fresca.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What a choice.

dialogues.speaker: SUSPICIOUS MAN
dialogues.text: Okay, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Wait. Thought you were thirsty. Not going to drink it now? The jittery man cracks open the can and drinks. Extremely awkward silence.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good?

dialogues.speaker: SUSPICIOUS MAN
dialogues.text: Yeah.  67. The man takes a swig and Bobby slaps the can out of his h

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Get the fuck out of here now. The man turns around and begins walking toward the front the motel. Bobby is right on his back, very threatening.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (through gritted teeth) I see you back on this property again and you won't be leaving it, understand?

dialogues.speaker: SUSPICIOUS MAN
dialogues.text: I don’t know what you’re talking about.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Yeah, you don’t know what I’m talking about? Gonna play it like that? They are passing by the lobby at this point, Bobby grabs man in a semi-headlock and reaches into his front pockets The feeble man is scared and squirms. Bobby quickly yanks a wallet. He opens it and looks at the driver’s license.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Alright... Charles Coachman of Cherry Hill, New Jersey...

dialogues.speaker: SUSPICIOUS MAN
dialogues.text: What business is that of yours? Bobby chucks the wallet over his head. The man pathetical chases after it.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Calling in your name to the precinct, motherfucker. See you here again and I swear to God... The man swiftly walks away towards Route 192.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonee is in the bathtub, eyes closed. The radio plays a HOP SONG. She dips her head in the water so only her nose mouth are not submerged.  68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A church group is parked at The Magic Castle. Residents t advantage of the food being passed out.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH VOLUNTEER
dialogues.text: Excited to go back to school?

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH VOLUNTEER
dialogues.text: No? Why not? Moonee gives her a look that says “stupidest question eve and grabs a loaf of white bread and jelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonee and Jancey sit under a giant uprooted tree. They a eating the jelly and bread.

dialogues.speaker: JANCEY
dialogues.text: This is the best jelly I ever eated.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: You love it?

dialogues.speaker: JANCEY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Going to marry it?

dialogues.speaker: JANCEY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: You're going to have to kiss it then. Jancey laughs and kisses the jelly.

dialogues.speaker: JANCEY
dialogues.text: This is a cool place for our new club to have for a meeting spot.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: You know why this is my favorite tree?  69.

dialogues.speaker: JANCEY
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: ‘Cause it tipped over, and it’s still growing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halley wakes up Moonee to take a bath. The clock reads 2: AM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby sees an UNFAMILIAR MAN exit room 323.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby is busy cleaning the pool as Ashley and Scooty approach. Bobby wraps up his cleaning duties as Ashley an Scooty go swimming.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Hey Ashley, just curious, have you been spotting Halley her rent?

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: What? Why would I do that? I don’t even talk to that bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halley and Moonee are staring down at the pool from the 3 floor balcony. Down the walkway, 2 GUYS are drooling over Ashley, a whistle to let her know they are there.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Can I go swimming with Scooty?

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: You're not going swimming while that bitch is down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halley and Moonee are talking while they watch TV. Halley’s phone rings. She picks it up and moves away from Moonee.  70.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Okay... go to the back of the parking lot. Far corner. Halley gets up and exits the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halley looks over the balcony. She watches a Volvo park.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: What kind of car you driving? (beat) You're not with any law enforcement are you? (beat) Room 323, baby. She hangs up. And walks back into the room.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Moonee! Bath time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby and Jack are attempting to drag a broken ice machin into the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I told you, you got to spin it.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I am.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Clockwise.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: This is clockwise.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. Okay. Well, counter- clockwise.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I am! They manage to move the bulky machine a few feet toward t elevator. Bobby’s eyes are racing. Deep breath. Jack noti this.  71.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I wished her a happy birthday for you by the way. Bobby straightens up.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: But I didn’t.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Push.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I didn’t. Why did you do that? Jack is still trying to push the machine. Bobby stops as get it half way into the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why would you do that? Call her and tell her I didn’t. The elevator door attempts to close. Bobby uses his foot keep it from shutting.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: First you get her on the phone and you tell her I didn’t wish her anything damn it.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Ya know what-- Jack backs off the ice machine.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Keep your hundred bucks.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Hey. I thought you’d appreciate the extra work.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Uh no. It takes an hour and a half to drive here. Totally screws my Saturday. I don’t need the extra work. Give your money to him. Jack turns and points to a resident sitting on the walkwa

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Or her. They need it. Or just tell your boss to hire an extra hand.  72. Bobby thinks for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Okay then. Just help me get this downstairs. The men continue to work.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And tell her I did not wish her anything. We’re all out of wishes over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scooty drives Ashley crazy by jumping on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTY
dialogues.text: Why can’t I play with Moonee?

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: You can play with other kids.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTY
dialogues.text: I don’t want to play with other kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonee is in the bathtub. We hear a door open off-screen. Moonee looks over. JOHN (30's) enters the room (we only hear his voice).

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (0.8)
dialogues.text: Jesus! There’s a kid in here?!

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Dude, I said the bathroom was off limits!

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (0.8)
dialogues.text: I had to piss. This is your kid?

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Moonee, pull the shower curtain. Moonee pulls the curtain. We hearing the sound of urinati on the other side of the curtain.  73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halley and Moonee visit a nearby theme park ticket hub an Halley attempts to sell four unused theme park ticket wristbands to TICKET HUT WORKER.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Do I look like a ticket scammer? These were never used, they don’t have the biometric finger print thingies or whatever they are assigned to them yet.

dialogues.speaker: TICKET HUT WORKER
dialogues.text: I understand but still not interested.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Who’s gonna know?

dialogues.speaker: TICKET HUT WORKER
dialogues.text: I don’t know what to tell you. Try at the parks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halley and Moonee loiter a bit further away from Ticket H A rental car pulls into the lot with BRITISH MOM, BRITISH BOY, BRITISH DAD. Dad hops out and walks toward the ticke place.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Hey, you going in there?

dialogues.speaker: BRITISH DAD
dialogues.text: I am.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Don’t buy from these places, they rope you into to buying timeshares. I got some I’m trying to sell.

dialogues.speaker: BRITISH DAD
dialogues.text: No thank you.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Dude, they’1l make you do a two hour tour and hard sell you, you really wanna do that shit on your vacation? Moonee holds out the multi-colored MagicBands displayed o her wrist like a used watch salesman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're selling the ticket bands?

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: I have four, they charge $164 per day so, that’s like $600, so I can do $400 cash.

dialogues.speaker: BRITISH DAD
dialogues.text: And these will work? No tricks?

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: They're totally unused. My family had to cancel our vacation and they don’t give refunds. But we didn’t use them, they’1ll work, I could even go with you to the front gates or whatever so you know I’m for real.

dialogues.speaker: BRITISH DAD
dialogues.text: These are Park-Hoppers, yeah?

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Sure. Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: TICKET-BUYING DAD
dialogues.text: Okay. Yeah. Okay. Shall we say

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Cash?

dialogues.speaker: BRITISH DAD
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Lowest I can go is $300. And that’s a steal, man.

dialogues.speaker: BRITISH DAD
dialogues.text: Right then. The dad takes out the cash.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Give the man the bands, Moon. Moonee reluctantly gives him the MagicBands, Halley takes cash.

dialogues.speaker: BRITISH DAD
dialogues.text: Thanks, sweetheart.  75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halley brings Moonee on a shopping spree and plays in the aisles of the Dollar Store. They exit and Halley pushes Moonee home in the shopping cart. They put on British accents, making fun of the dad they just sold bands to.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Are they... pok-hoppahs?

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Me needs dem pok-hoppahs! They giggle as they speed up and ride coast along with th shopping cart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halley watches as Bobby scans Halley’s rent money, mostly bills, under the counterfeit detector. Amber is working i the background. Moonee is outside, sitting in the shoppin cart.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Back in the work force?

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Say what?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: New job?

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Interesting hours.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Number one, I see you around in PJ's all day, every day. Number two, if you are working, who’s looking after Moonee?

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Umm, mind you own business, Bro. Bobby looks and sees Moonee in the shopping cart outside lobby. Moonee waves.  76.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Get that stolen cart off the property.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halley and Moonee are on the bed. There is pounding at th door. Halley gets up and looks through the peep hole. She turns around and walks back to the bed.

dialogues.speaker: MOONEE
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Nobody. Go away asshole or I’m gonna call the police!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see our bathroom John pounding on the door. He continu as Bobby approaches.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Hey. Hey. Hey. What’s goin’ on?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: None of your business, Bro.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: It is my business. I’m the manager here. What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: The girl who lives here has something of mine.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: The six year-old?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: No. The mom. Bobby knocks on the door and convinces Halley to open it.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: This guy says you have something of his.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: I don’t know who this guy is.  77.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: She doesn’t know who you are. Wrong girl. Now c’mon. Gotta to leave the property if you’re not staying here.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I’m not leaving until she gives me my four MagicBands. She lifted four MagicBands from my jeans.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: What the fuck is a Magical Band? I don’t what this guy is talkin’ about.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: When I was in the bathroom, you took my family’s fucking bands.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Let’s go. She doesn’t know what you're talking about. Halley has not changed her blank expression.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I know you know what I’m talking about Goddamnit! I want them back NOW! You stole $1700. That’s grand larceny. That lost profit margin stings Halley but she retains her composure. Bobby intervenes.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Listen, bud, look, I’1l be happy to call the cops right now. We'll put in a report. You can tell them what your business was on the premises. Four of those bracelets? So I can assume this was for your wife and children, yeah? John has calmed down.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Right. So why don’t you get the fuck off this property now and don't let me see you here again. John leaves, defeated.  78.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: It’s about time you make yourself useful, can you believe that shit? Bobby takes a deep breath and slowly turns around to Hall

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I am trying to keep this job. And I am going to keep this job. I’m trying to keep this place free of headaches. And you are the biggest headache.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: I’m your biggest headache? You got MS-13 in 204, dude.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I swear to God, Halley. No more. If you have guests, they have to check in with me at the front desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby walks towards the front office, Halley follows, barefoot and in pajamas.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you talking about? Moonee begins to follow her mother onto the walkway.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get the fuck back inside, Moonee! Moonee complies.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You can’t just NOT let me have guests. What gives you the authority!

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Um, my job title?

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: I have friends though, I have a lot friends.  79.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: They're gonna have to check in with me. That means ID. They have to leave it at the front desk.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: That's like invasion of privacy shit. Bobby almost laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobby enters the lobby followed by Halley. Amber is behin the counter.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Oh fuck you, Bobby, I don’t gotta do shit.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Out of the lobby. Now. Seriously. You have three seconds to get out of the lobby or you’re outta here tonight. I’m sure the Hope Center has a room for you somewhere. Stare down.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One. Two... Halley leaves swearing her ass off. From outside, she continues to berate Bobby but he ignores her. Finally, she takes out a maxi-pad from and sticks it to t lobby window. She storms off.

dialogues.speaker: AMBER
dialogues.text: And I thought I’ve seen it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halley and Moonee sit on washing machines in back of Magi Castle. A previously-seen woman comes by, sees Halley, tu around.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY
dialogues.text: Bobby fixed these? She ignores her and continues to walk away.  80.

dialogues.speaker: HALLEY, (CONT'D)
